title: Margaret A. Maglione - Profile
description: Staff profile for Margaret A. Maglione, Adjunct Researcher at the RAND Corporation.
cleaned_text: Margaret Maglione is an adjunct researcher at the RAND Corporation. For many years, she was the associate director of the Southern California Evidence-Based Practice Center (EPC), one of the leading institutions worldwide for the creation of systematic reviews, meta-analyses, and other evidence-based products. Maglione has led projects funded by the U.S. Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, the Defense Center for Excellence (DCoE) for Psychological Health and Traumatic Brain Injury, the Undersecretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness, the Health Resources and Services Administration, and various specialty societies and charitable foundations. Her research topics have been diverse, ranging from the safety and efficacy of dietary supplements containing ephedra to a systematic review on the effectiveness of interventions for autism spectrum disorders in children and work with a panel of experts to develop new guidelines. Maglione also led a project assessing the safety of vaccines recommended for routine use in children, adolescents, and adults. Maglione received a B.A. in economics from Columbia University and an M.P.P. in public policy from the University of Southern California.
